meanings.definition: To be the cause or basis of something
meanings.sent1: The strong foundation underlies the stability of the building.
meanings.sent2: Healthy eating habits underlie good physical health.
meanings.sent3: The secret ingredient underlies the success of the famous recipe.
meanings.sent4: Trust and honesty underlie a strong friendship.
meanings.sent5: Kindness and compassion underlie her actions towards others.

meanings.definition: To be situated or placed beneath something
meanings.sent1: The treasure chest was underlie a pile of old books.
meanings.sent2: The roots of the tree underlie the surface of the ground.
meanings.sent3: The hidden trapdoor underlie the rug in the old mansion.
meanings.sent4: Dark clouds underlie the bright blue sky.
meanings.sent5: The truth always underlie the lies.

meanings.definition: To be hidden or not easily seen
meanings.sent1: The real meaning underlies the cryptic message.
meanings.sent2: His true emotions underlie his calm exterior.
meanings.sent3: The subtle clues underlie the mystery novel.
meanings.sent4: The complexity of the issue underlies the simple solution.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the painting underlies the artist's skill.
